title: Daily Market Digest: February 20, 2026
subtitle: A professional overview of today's market activities.

items.headline: Global Markets Exhibit Mixed to Cautious Sentiment Amid Geopolitical Tensions and AI Fears
items.summary: Global equities are navigating a complex landscape today, with a prevailing sense of caution driven by escalating US-Iran tensions and lingering uncertainties surrounding the impact of artificial intelligence. While some US stock futures showed modest gains in Asian trading, many markets are anticipating a potentially volatile close to the week. Wall Street experienced a wobble on Thursday, with major indices closing lower, and Indian benchmarks are poised for a softer opening.

items.statContext: Closed down Thursday. Futures slightly up Friday. Equal-weighted S&P 500 up 5.8% YTD, while tech-heavy market-cap weighted S&P 500 up 0.2% YTD.
Closed down Thursday. Nasdaq 100 E-mini climbed 42 points in Asian session. Red Cat ($RCAT) set to ring Nasdaq Opening Bell.
Closed down Thursday, dropping over 260 points. Dow Jones E-mini advanced 44 points in Asian session. Projected close for DJIA is 49,150 to 49,650.

items.headline: Insmed (INSM) Surges on Strong Q4 Revenue
items.summary: Insmed led Nasdaq 100 gainers after reporting Q4 net product revenue of $263.8 million, surpassing the consensus estimate of $262.5 million.

items.headline: Quanta Services (PWR) Rises on Impressive Q4 and Outlook
items.summary: Quanta Services saw significant gains following Q4 revenue of $7.84 billion, exceeding the $7.40 billion consensus, and a robust full-year revenue forecast of $33.25 billion to $33.75 billion.

items.headline: CF Industries Holdings (CF) Boosted by Strong Q4 Sales
items.summary: CF Industries Holdings experienced an upward movement after reporting Q4 net sales of $1.87 billion, above the expected $1.76 billion.

items.headline: Hindalco Industries Ltd Sees Strong Gains
items.summary: Hindalco Industries Ltd surged in the current trading session.

items.headline: Booking Holdings (BKNG) Drops Amid AI Competition Concerns
items.summary: Booking Holdings experienced one of the market's sharper losses due to worries that AI-powered competitors could disrupt its industry.

items.headline: Infosys Ltd Retreats in Trading
items.summary: Infosys Ltd retreated during the trading session.

items.headline: UltraTech Cement Ltd Declines
items.summary: UltraTech Cement Ltd saw a decline in its share price.

items.headline: Sector Rotation Favors Tangible Industries; Tech and AI Under Pressure
items.summary: A notable shift in equity leadership is underway, with real and tangible sectors such as Industrials, Energy, and Materials now leading, while Technology, Communication Services, and Financials are experiencing accelerating underperformance. This rotation reflects a move away from big tech and artificial intelligence into previously lagging sectors like financials. However, chipmakers and AI-infrastructure stocks continue to face pressure amidst ongoing AI fears. Utilities and Real Estate are also showing strength, with utilities benefiting from demand for data centers.

items.headline: Geopolitical Risks Drive Oil to 7-Month High
items.summary: Rising tensions in the Middle East, particularly concerning the US and Iran, have pushed WTI crude oil to a 7-month high near $66.80. This geopolitical uncertainty is a significant factor contributing to the cautious market sentiment globally.

items.headline: Fed Rate Cut Expectations Temper Ahead of Key Economic Data
items.summary: The probability of a June Fed rate cut has decreased from 62.3% on February 12 to 58.0% today, February 20. Markets still anticipate two Fed rate cuts in 2026, targeting a year-end rate of 3.00%-3.25%. Later today, key economic data including Services PMI, Personal Income and Outlays report, Q4 GDP, PCE data, New Home Sales, and Revised UoM Consumer Sentiment will be released, which could further influence Fed policy expectations. Fed officials, including Mary Daly, are closely monitoring AI's economic effects.

items.headline: Select Companies Report Earnings, AI Investment Plans Unveiled
items.summary: Today sees earnings reports from companies like Anglogold Ashanti Plc ($AU), Esab Corp ($ESAB), Lamar Advertising Co ($LAMR), PPL Corp ($PPL), and The Western Union Co ($WU). DistributionNOW ($DNOW) is also hosting its Q4 2025 earnings call. Notably, Moody's ($MCO) reported strong Q4 results and increased its dividend, while Heico ($HEI) also had a good fiscal Q4. In strategic developments, Tata Consultancy Services ($TCS) announced a partnership with OpenAI to build AI infrastructure in India, and Reliance Industries detailed a â‚¹10 lakh crore investment into AI.

items.headline: Japan to Invest $36 Billion in US Projects
items.summary: Good news on the economic front as the U.S. Commerce Department announced that Japan plans to fund three projects totaling approximately $36 billion in Ohio, Texas, and Georgia. This marks the first wave of investments from a pledged $550 billion trade deal with the U.S., including a significant natural gas-fired power plant in Portsmouth, Ohio.
